channel.title: What exactly does it mean to 'pass information' into a method?
channel.description: Or into a constructor, I guess. I'm learning how to do it, I'm just not exactly sure what it is, lol.

item.title: What exactly does it mean to 'pass information' into a method?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“T4_, post:6, topic:283917”][quote author=Apoc link=topic=375223.msg2828182#msg2828182 date=1245189915]

void aVoid(int anInt) {
anInt++;
return anInt;
}

System.out.println(aVoid(10));

I guess…?
[/quote]You do realize that you’re trying to return an Integer from a method that isn’t suppose return anything, right?

Beat me to it; wonder why Speljohan didn’t spot it. :P[/quote]
Wan To Fite Noob Im Lvl 99
[center] [/center]

Read full topic
item.source: What exactly does it mean to 'pass information' into a method?

return anInt;

item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:2, topic:283917”]void aVoid(int anInt) {
anInt++;
return anInt;
}

System.out.println(aVoid(10));

I guess…?[/quote]Way to overcomplicate it.

public void passInformationToMePlease(String theInformationToPass) {
System.out.println(“You have passed the information: " + theInformationToPass + " to this method, gz!”);
}

ruler-eque example.
